name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main  # Trigger CI/CD when there's a push to the main branch
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main  # Trigger CI/CD on pull request targeting the main branch

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4

    # Step 1: Set up Python environment (if it's a Python project)
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: '3.x'  # Choose your Python version here

    # Step 2: Install dependencies (this assumes there's a requirements.txt)
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m venv venv
        source venv/bin/activate
        pip install -r requirements.txt

    # Step 3: Run Tests (unit tests, integration tests, etc.)
    - name: Run Tests
      run: |
        python -m unittest discover -s tests

    # Step 4: Build Docker image (if it's a Docker project)
    - name: Build Docker Image
      run: |
        docker build . --file Dockerfile --tag username/repository:v2

    # Step 5: Push Docker image to Docker Hub (if you're using Docker)
    - name: Push Docker Image
      env:
        USER: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
        PASS: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}
      run: |
        docker login -u $USER -p $PASS
        docker push username/repository:v2

    # Step 6: Deploy to Staging (or production)
    - name: Deploy to Staging
      run: |
        # Add deployment steps (e.g., deploy to server, Kubernetes, etc.)
        # For example, SSH to a server and deploy the Docker image.
